title: Simpelveld
text:
Simpelveld (; ) is a <a href="Municipalities%20of%20the%20Netherlands">municipality</a> and a <a href="town">town</a> in the southeastern <a href="Netherlands">Netherlands</a>. It is part of the municipal cooperative unit <a href="Parkstad%20Limburg">Parkstad Limburg</a>. 
Simpelveld is part of the "Mergelland", named after the presence of <a href="chalk">chalk</a> (mergel), <a href="hill">hill</a> country popular with tourists. The <a href="Mergellandroute">Mergellandroute</a> passes through the town. 
The population centre of Simpelveld has 28 <a href="Rijksmonument">national monuments</a>, amongst which are the <a href="Oude%20Molen%2C%20Simpelveld">Oude Molen</a> and the <a href="Saint%20Remigius%20Church">Saint Remigius Church</a>. Simpelveld has a <a href="heritage%20railway">heritage railway</a> station and is the home base of the <a href="Zuid-Limburgse%20Stoomtrein%20Maatschappij">South Limburg Railway Company</a>. On one weekend in October there is a <a href="Day%20out%20with%20Thomas">Day out with Thomas</a> from the children's television series <a href="Thomas%20and%20Friends">Thomas and Friends</a>.

Regional language.
Simpelveld is part of The Netherlands and therefore the official language is Dutch. A lot of people also speak Simpelvelds, a <a href="regional%20language">regional language</a> that depending on the definition belongs to <a href="Ripuarian%20language">Ripuarian</a> or <a href="Limburgish">Limburgish</a>. It is also referred to as <a href="Southeast%20Limburgish">Southeast Limburgish</a>.
